page.title: 17Transport in Ripe.
page.content: Trains run once every hour from Berwick, 3 miles South of Ripe. This line goes to London, Brighton and Hastings. Buses run infrequently from Firle or Laughton both 3 miles distant so nearly everybody travels by private car. Owning a car is quite an expense as it has to conform to M.O.T. standards which means regular servicing and high garage bills. Also to pass the driving test one needs many driving lessons and even then not everyone can get through the test. The alternative is motorbike or pushbiike. The roads, although only C. roads are well maintained by the County Council.The ramblers association looks after some of the footpaths and many are rights of way so walking is another way of getting about and also a recreation. Also there are many horse riders and ponies and carts.
